sentences.english: An army of doctors blitzed the disease .
sentences.chinese: 一大批医生对这种疾病发起猛攻。

sentences.english: The insurgents, all intent on the attack, which was imminent, had their backs turned to these two.
sentences.chinese: 起义者对即将到来的猛攻全神贯注，身子都转了过去。

sentences.english: They launched a violent attack on the enemy at dawn.
sentences.chinese: 他们在拂晓时向敌人发动猛攻。

sentences.english: They hurled themselves at [upon] the enemy.
The city resisted the enemy onslaught for two weeks.
sentences.chinese: 这个城市反抗敌人的猛攻达两个星期之久。

sentences.english: The tanks stormed towards the city.
The Chinese team led with a strong attack and scored a goal in 10 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 中国队一开场就进行猛攻，并在10分钟内进了一球。

sentences.english: Noise that we're blasting into our brains by our own volition.
sentences.chinese: 这些由我们自身意愿猛攻入我们大脑中的噪声。
游击队员们突然发起猛攻。

definition: to besiege/to beleaguer/to attack from all sides/to jointly speak or write against sb
to attack for a long time without success
to face an attack/to repulse the enemy
to advance on sth/to press closely (on some goal)
attack from two sides/pincer movement/converging attack/attack on a flank/fork in chess, with one piece making two attacks
to guard/to hold a fortified position/entrenched
to retreat and defend/to withdraw and maintain one's guard
pincer attack/attack from two or more sides/converging attack/attack on a flank/fork in chess, with one piece making two attacks
to counterattack/to come back after a defeat/to retrieve lost ground
